title: Race Question in Supreme Court Adoption Case Unnerves Tribes
description: The issue is whether a federal law that seeks to place Native American foster children in Native American homes is constitutional. The case could turn on whether the justices see tribes as racial groups or sovereign nations.
dc:creator: Jan Hoffman
media:credit: Allison V. Smith for The New York Times
media:description: Y.R.J., a girl whose birth mother is Navajo but who is living with a white family who wants to adopt her, is at the center of a dispute that may overturn the Indian Child Welfare Act of 1978.
